channel.title: Webdev on juri.strumpflohner
channel.description: Recent content in Webdev on juri.strumpflohner

item.title: TypeScript: Application scale JavaScript
item.description: This article is about Hejlsberg’s talk about TypeScript at the Build 2013 conference. TypeScript is now already around for about 9 months or so and I like the concept behind of being something to improve the tooling around JavaScript but not really re-inventing a(nother) new language that compiles to it.

item.title: Learning JavaScriptMVC
item.description: About half a year ago, Packt Publishing approached me for a technical review of a new book about JavaScriptMVC they were about to publish. I agreed and started to participate in the review process.

item.title: Caching, jQuery Ajax and Other IE Fun
item.description: In the last couple of days I had quite a fun time debugging problems of our JavaScript SPAs on oldIE (thanks God we got the Browserstack licenses).

item.title: Output Caching in ASP.net MVC
item.description: Although nowadays most of us have broadband connections, resource caching is important as loading a resource from your local HD is (by now) still faster than fetching it remotely.

item.title: It's time to learn CoffeeScript
item.description: Seing and reading all the stuff about CoffeeScript, I thought it might be useful to get into that “language” as well in order to get a better understanding.
